usefulItems: bowl, plastic wrap, baking paper, springform cake tin (20 cm), refrigerator, freezer
title: Frozen mojito cheesecake

ingredients.content: 160 g Granita™ biscuits, broken into pieces
2 limes, zested and juiced (approx. 40 g juice)

preparations.content: Line base of a springform cake tin (20 cm) with baking paper.
Place biscuits and butter into mixing bowl and mix <b>10-20 sec/speed 5<b>, until combined.  Press evenly into base of prepared tin. Transfer into refrigerator until ready to use.
Place sugar, lime zest and mint leaves into mixing bowl and chop <b>10 sec/speed 9<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and chop <b>5 sec/speed 9<b>.
Add cream cheese and mix <b>1 min/speed 4<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add lime juice and rum and mix <b>10 sec/speed 4<b>. Transfer into a bowl and set aside.
<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place cream into mixing bowl and whip <b>20 sec/speed 4<b> until firm, watching carefully through hole in mixing bowl lid to avoid overwhipping.
Add reserved cream cheese mixture and mix <b>6 sec//speed 4<b>.
Scrape down sides of mixing bowl and mix <b>3 sec//speed 3<b>.

<b>Remove butterfly whisk<b>. Pour mixture over reserved biscuit base. Smooth top and cover with plastic wrap. Transfer into freezer for a minimum of 6 hours or overnight. Decorate as desired. Serve frozen, or allow to partially thaw before serving.

hintsAndTricks: You may need an extra lime to obtain 40 g lime juice.
